greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of proper unitary divisors (or unitary aliquot parts) of n, including 1.
comment: For definition of unitary divisor see A034448.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537 (first 1000 terms from Harry J. Smith)
formula: For n > 1: a(n) = sum (A077610(n,k): k = 1 .. A034444(n) - 1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 12 2012
example: a(10) = 8 because the unitary divisors of 10 are 1, 2, 5 and 10, with sum 18 and 18-10 = 8.
mathematica: a[n_] := Total[Select[Divisors[n], GCD[#, n/#] == 1&]]-n; a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 82}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 31 2011 *)
program: (PARI) usigma(n) = sumdiv(n, d, if(gcd(d, n/d)==1, d))
{ for (n=1, 1000, if (n>1, a=usigma(n) - n, a=1); write("b063919.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 02 2009
A034460(n) = (sumdivmult(n, d, if(gcd(d, n/d)==1, d))-n); \\ From A034460
a063919 n = sum $ init $ a077610_row n
xref: The values of sequence are A034448(n)-n (for n > 1).
results.author: _Felice Russo_, Aug 31 2001
